titleStmt.title: World Wide Diplomatic Archives Index: Honduras
Honduras

div.head: Legislation
div.p: The Honduran Government passed a Law on Transparency and Access to Public Information that came into effect in January 2007 to provide a system of access and declassification to government documents. Individual Ministers, however, have strong powers to reserve documents from the public that may be construed as dangerous to humanitarian aid, national security, economic stability or smooth governance.

div.head: Location
div.p: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs is located in Tegucigalpa.

div.head: Procedures
div.p: Researchers must apply directly to the Foreign Ministry to request access to documents.

div.head: Published Documents
div.p: The Foreign Ministry produces a yearly “Memoir of the Secretary of State of Foreign Relations” and a quarterly publication “Revista de la Cancilleria de Honduras.”
